channel.title: Chief archetect
channel.description:
Alright today at school i was introduced to chief archetect, its a program you can use to design buildings interior and exterior + you can decide the yard seroundings ect. I was just wondering if any one else has used this program and if you'd recomend it so i know weather to get it for my home computer or just not to waste my time. Wasnt 100% sure one weather or not to post here or in the graphics help, kind of general but kind of asking for help. If needed just move.
Thanks

But good job Googling.[/quote]

[b]I spent a year in school trying to learn CAD[/b]; either my teacher was bad, or [b]the program was just too hard to learn.[/b] I never quite got the hang of it.

item.title: Chief archetect

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

FastBawlz:

No one said it was a program…

More than one person said it. Either that, or they fail at English. “CAD is hard to use” = CAD being a program, not a process.

item.title: Chief archetect
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“javis, post:9, topic:228563”]pretty sure its the first one @ the bank. All i really know is that it had 3d views which you could actually go inside the house and design all sorts or interesting things. The library it has for features like adding cabnets to adding the smallest things like a vase is by far one of the most impressive ive seen. the teacher that was in the class said that he’d even seen some one add things like a deer out side.

As for the rest, even if you hated the class would you enjoy playing with the program at home? i thought from what i saw it was cool but i only had a small lil intro before i had to move along so i didnt get a chance to really look into it.[/quote]

Ya, AutoCAD, that’s what a lot of people use.

autodesk.com

AutoCAD For Mac & Windows | CAD Software | Autodesk

Architects, engineers, and construction professionals rely on the innovative design tools in AutoCAD software to create precise 2D and 3D drawings.

Read full topic

item.title: Chief archetect
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

pretty sure its the first one @ the bank. All i really know is that it had 3d views which you could actually go inside the house and design all sorts or interesting things. The library it has for features like adding cabnets to adding the smallest things like a vase is by far one of the most impressive ive seen. the teacher that was in the class said that he’d even seen some one add things like a deer out side.

As for the rest, even if you hated the class would you enjoy playing with the program at home? i thought from what i saw it was cool but i only had a small lil intro before i had to move along so i didnt get a chance to really look into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Chief archetect
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:228563”]CAD isn’t a program, its just a blanket term for technical drawing on a computer.

There’s a handful of different popular CAD packages - but yes, they’re all fairly complex (although not as bad as the CAM/CNC stuff)[/quote]

No one said it was a program…

Read full topic

item.title: Chief archetect
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

CAD isn’t a program, its just a blanket term for technical drawing on a computer.

There’s a handful of different popular CAD packages - but yes, they’re all fairly complex (although not as bad as the CAM/CNC stuff)

Read full topic

item.title: Chief archetect
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:4, topic:228563”]Err, do you mean this:

Or this:

If it is the second one, it is a piece of shit.[/quote]

I’m pretty sure he is talking about the second one. I spent a year in school trying to learn CAD; either my teacher was bad, or the program was just too hard to learn. I never quite got the hang of it.
